title: Check codegen backends for compatibility with the loading rustc

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This would have helped with https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/182449-t-compiler.2Fhelp/topic/.E2.9C.94.20How.20to.20load.20codegen.20backend.20when.20custom-built.20rustc where a codegen backend was accidentally built against the librustc_driver.so of a rustc different from the one which actually loaded the codegen backend.

Checking just the rustc version in the `.rustc` section of the dylib is not correct. For example if a stage 1 rustc is used the librustc_driver.so it will compile the codegen backend against doesn't match the librustc_driver.so the rustc is linked against. The librustc_driver.so it is linked against is compiled by a different version of rustc.

It should instead check the dylib dependency list to see if the hash in the filename of librustc_driver.so as depended on by the codegen backend matches the librustc_driver.so depended on by the current rustc.

cc @antoyo
